title: Fed slashes interest rates by a half-point, an aggressive start to its first easing campaign in four years
content: The Federal Reserve on Wednesday released its decision regarding interest rates.

title: Will the U.S. elections impact crypto markets? Insiders weigh in

title: Taiwan manufacturer rejects links to Lebanon's exploding pager attacks, names Hungarian firm
content: The company said that the design and manufacturing of the pagers were handled by a Hungary-based company called BAC.
summary: The company said that the design and manufacturing of the pagers were handled by a Hungary-based company called BAC.

title: Boeing starts furloughing tens of thousands of employees amid machinist strike
content: CEO Kelly Ortberg said affected employees would take one week of furlough every four weeks for the strike's duration and he and his team would take pay cuts.
summary: CEO Kelly Ortberg said affected employees would take one week of furlough every four weeks for the strike's duration and he and his team would take pay cuts.

title: 111 Republican former officials endorse Harris, say Trump is 'unfit to serve'
content: Kamala Harris' campaign has netted Republican endorsements from numerous Trump administration officials as well as from figures such as Dick Cheney.
summary: Kamala Harris' campaign has netted Republican endorsements from numerous Trump administration officials as well as from figures such as Dick Cheney.

title: This 38-year-old is financially independent with passive income. Here's how he built a 7-figure real estate portfolio

summary: Shu Matsuo Post, 38, has reached financial independence after building a seven-figure real estate portfolio. Today, he lives in Japan with his wife and kids.

title: Novartis not joining the 'frenzy' of weight loss drugs, CEO says

title: Google wins court challenge to the EU's $1.7 billion antitrust fine over ad product
content: The European Union's second-highest court on Wednesday said a 1.5 billion euro ($1.7 billion) antitrust fine imposed on Google by regulators should be annulled.

title: UK inflation holds steady in August, matching expectations
content: U.K. inflation came in at 2.2% for the month of August, data from the Office for National Statistics showed Wednesday.

title: Japan faces labor shortages and demographic crisis as elderly population hits record high

title: Oil stares at a bleak future as China's economy sputters. The good news: A market 'bust' is unlikely
content: Lower oil prices were the dominant theme in Asia's largest oil conference. The question was not whether oil will go lower, but mostly by how much will it decline in the coming years.
